messages.message: Have we tested using Istio within IB for ingress controllers and pod to pod encryption?
@Cody Boggs has been working on this (via envoy instead of istio)!
If we can do this with envoy, do we feel comforatble being able to flip the switch to istio if customer req it

:+1: Am indeed :slightly_smiling_face:

And sooo close. :laughing:

In terms of IB-owned infrastructure (particularly SaaS efforts) I expect we’ll lean on something established, like Istio or similar.

For customer-owned installations, we’re rolling this out as an in-house solution due to customer constraints

That’s a tricky one - Envoy is going to facilitate a number of capabilities that we need in the product (observability, load balancing, request routing, mTLS, etc). It will certainly be possible to turn it all off, but the introduction of Istio will be a wildcard once we’ve begun to leverage these extra capabilities from Envoy alone
We will be getting asked this type of question from an RFP that will be coming from UBS. Are far out do we see this functionality / testing with Envoy? < 6m?
I can only speak for mTLS, but my goal is to have it rolled out in dogfood (at minimum) by the end of this quarter
Not sure it’ll be ready for customer use by then, as we’ll discover issues as we go
Apprecaite the feedback. I may grab some time on your calendar in the next few weeks
